result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quill Running Buffalo Hawk

09:25 AM Defendant Quill Running Buffalo Hawk in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Quill Running Buffalo Hawk in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Chapman indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness Sgt, Ian Hall, Court sworn in witness.  State begins examination.  9:26 AM  Witness identified the DEF, Attny Chapman no objection, Court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.    9:31 AM Attny Chapman makes Objection, Speculation- Court grants.   State re-asks question.  9:33 AM  Atty Chapman cross examination.   9:34 AM Attny Chapman no further questions.  No further witnesses by either parties.  9:34 AM  Witness excused.   State request for bind over.  Attny Chapman no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Atty Chapman makes bond modication request, Attny Chapman indicates Contact with M. Stoner and bed available at treatment facility at Magnolia Ranch in Tennessee.   State objects to bond modification.   Court makes statement/discussion takes place.    Court denies bond request at this time, and request more information regarding treatment.  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
